objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The National Cyber Security Centre is the author and publisher of this malware analysis report on SparrowDoor. NCSC provides technical analysis, detection signatures, and recommendations regarding the SparrowDoor malware variant.

objects.name: SparrowDoor C2 domain
objects.description: Primary command and control domain used by SparrowDoor malware, specified in the malware configuration.

objects.name: SparrowDoor proxy IP
objects.description: Proxy IP address configured for network communications by SparrowDoor malware.

objects.name: SparrowDoor loader (libcurl.dll)
objects.description: Malicious DLL loader used in SparrowDoor's reflective loading process, located in a suspicious directory.

objects.name: SparrowDoor backdoor (libhost.dll)
objects.description: Obfuscated backdoor DLL loaded by libcurl.dll, stores configuration and shellcode.

objects.name: Renamed Notepad++ updater (SearchIndexer.exe)
objects.description: Renamed and weaponized Notepad++ updater used by SparrowDoor as a persistence and loader mechanism.

objects.name: SparrowDoor mutex
objects.description: Mutex created by SparrowDoor malware to prevent multiple instances running.

objects.name: Primary persistence registry key (Service)
objects.description: Registry key used to register SparrowDoor as a Windows Service for persistence.

objects.name: Backup persistence registry key (Run key)
objects.description: Registry key used as backup persistence to execute SearchIndexer.exe at logon.

objects.name: Clipboard log file
objects.description: File created by SparrowDoor for logging clipboard data in the malware directory.

objects.name: Indicator for libcurl.dll (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of SparrowDoor loader DLL (libcurl.dll).

objects.name: Indicator for libcurl.dll (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of SparrowDoor loader DLL (libcurl.dll).

objects.name: Indicator for libcurl.dll (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of SparrowDoor loader DLL (libcurl.dll).

objects.name: Indicator for libhost.dll (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of SparrowDoor backdoor DLL (libhost.dll).

objects.name: Indicator for libhost.dll (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of SparrowDoor backdoor DLL (libhost.dll).

objects.name: Indicator for libhost.dll (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of SparrowDoor backdoor DLL (libhost.dll).

objects.name: Indicator for SearchIndexer.exe (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of weaponized Notepad++ updater (SearchIndexer.exe).

objects.name: Indicator for SearchIndexer.exe (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of weaponized Notepad++ updater (SearchIndexer.exe).

objects.name: Indicator for SearchIndexer.exe (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of weaponized Notepad++ updater (SearchIndexer.exe).

objects.name: sparrowdoor
objects.description: SparrowDoor is a persistent 32-bit loader and backdoor targeting the Windows operating system. It performs reflective loading of a PE payload without headers, employs XOR encoding for the C2 channel over HTTPS, implements multiple defense evasion techniques (including inline hooks, AV detection), and provides functionality for reading/writing files, reverse shell access, clipboard logging, API hooking, token impersonation, and the use of both Windows services and registry keys for persistence. It contains routines to evade common AV products and delivers commands from a C2 server via an encrypted and encoded channel.

objects.name: ESET
objects.description: ESET is referenced as the organization which previously reported the original SparrowDoor malware variant in September 2021.

objects.name: Kaspersky
objects.description: Kaspersky is identified as the company behind one of the AV process names ('avp.exe') checked by SparrowDoor during its defense evasion routines.

objects.name: ESET
objects.description: ESET is listed as the AV company behind the 'egui.exe' process name which SparrowDoor searches for during its defense evasion routines.

objects.name: Symantec
objects.description: Symantec is associated with several process names (ccSetMgr.exe, ccSvcHst.exe, ccapp.exe) that SparrowDoor checks for as part of its AV detection routine.

objects.name: Trend Micro
objects.description: Trend Micro is identified as the AV vendor behind 'TMBMSRV.exe', a process name searched for by SparrowDoor.

objects.name: Comodo Firewall Pro
objects.description: Comodo Firewall Pro is the AV product associated with the 'cpf.exe' process name checked by SparrowDoor.

objects.name: McAfee
objects.description: McAfee is referenced as the AV company for the 'Mcshield.exe' process name that SparrowDoor checks.

objects.name: 360.cn
objects.description: 360.cn (Qihoo 360) is associated with the 'ZhuDongFangYu.exe' process checked by the malware for AV detection.

objects.name: SparrowDoor_apipatch
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_apipatch {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
  description = "Identifies code segments in SparrowDoor
responsible for patching APIs. No MZ/PE match as the backdoor has no
header. Targeting in memory."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"
    strings:
        $save = {8B 06 89 07 8A 4E 04} // save off first 5 bytes of
function
  $vp_1 = {89 10 8A 4E 04 8B D6 2B D0 88 48 04 83 EA 05 C6 40 05 E9
89 50 06} // calculate long jump
  $vp_2 = {50 8B D6 6A 40 2B D7 88 4F 04 83 EA 05 6A 05 C6 47 05 E9
89 57 06 56} // calculate long jump 2
  $vp_3 = {51 52 2B DE 6A 05 83 EB 05 56 C6 06 E9 89 5E 01} //
restore memory protections
  $va = {6A 40 68 00 10 00 00 68 00 10 00 00 6A 00} // virtually
alloc set size, allocation and protection
  $s_patch = {50 68 7F FF FF FF 68 FF FF 00 00 56} // socket patch
SO_DONTLINGER
    condition:
    3 of them
}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_clipshot
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
import "pe"
rule SparrowDoor_clipshot {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
  description = "The SparrowDoor loader contains a feature it calls
clipshot, which logs clipboard data to a file."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "989b3798841d06e286eb083132242749c80fdd4d"
    strings:
        $exsting_cmp = {8B 1E 3B 19 75 ?? 83 E8 04 83 C1 04 83 C6 04 83 F8 04} // comparison routine for previous clipboard data
  $time_format_string = "%d/%d/%d %d:%d" ascii
  $cre_fil_args = {6A 00 68 80 00 00 00 6A 04 6A 00 6A 02 68 00 00 00 40 52}
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them and (pe.imports("User32.dll","OpenClipboard") and
pe.imports("User32.dll","GetClipboardData") and
pe.imports("Kernel32.dll","GetLocalTime") and
pe.imports("Kernel32.dll","GlobalSize"))
}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_config
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_config {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
  description = "Targets the XOR encoded loader config and
shellcode in the file libhost.dll using the known position of the XOR
key."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"
    condition:
        (uint16(0) != 0x5A4D) and
        (uint16(0) != 0x8b55) and
  (uint32(0) ^ uint32(0x4c) ==  0x00) and
  (uint32(0) ^ uint32(0x34) ==  0x00) and
  (uint16(0) ^ uint16(0x50) ==  0x8b55)
}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_loader
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_loader {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
  description = "Targets code features of the SparrowDoor loader.
This rule detects the previous variant and this new variant."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "989b3798841d06e286eb083132242749c80fdd4d"
    strings:
  $xor_algo = {8B D0 83 E2 03 8A 54 14 10 30 14 30 40 3B C1}
  $rva = {8D B0 [4] 8D 44 24 ?? 50 6A 40 6A 05 56} // load RVA of
process exe
        $lj = {2B CE 83 E9 05 8D [3] 52 C6 06 E9 89 4E 01 8B [3] 50 6A 05 56} // calculate long jump
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them
}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_shellcode
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: SparrowDoor_sleep_routine
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_sleep_routine {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "SparrowDoor implements a Sleep routine with value
seeded on GetTickCount. This signature detects the previous and this
variant of SparrowDoor. No MZ/PE match as the backdoor has no header.
Targeting in memory."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"
    strings:
        $sleep = {FF D7 33 D2 B9 [4] F7 F1 81 C2 [4] 8B C2 C1 E0 04 2B C2 03 C0 03 C0 03 C0 50}
    condition:
  all of them
}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_xor
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: SparrowDoor_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Strings that appear in SparrowDoor's backdoor.
Targeting in memory."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"
    strings:
        $reg = "Software\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\Run" ascii
$http_headers = {55 73 65 72 2D 41 67 65 6E 74 3A 20 4D 6F 7A 69 6C 6C 61 2F 34 2E 30 20 28 63 6F 6D 70 61 74 69 62 6C 65 3B 20 4D 53 49 45 20 35 2E 30 3B 20 57 69 6E 64 6F 77 73 20 4E 54 20 35 2E 30 29 0D 0A 41 63 63 65 70 74 2D 4C 61 6E 67 75 61 67 65 3A 20 65 6E 2D 55 53 0D 0A 41 63 63 65 70 74 3A 20 2A 2F 2A 0D 0A}
$http_proxy = "HTTPS=HTTPS://%s:%d" ascii
$debug = "SeDebugPrivilege" ascii
$av1 = "avp.exe" ascii // Kaspersky
$av2 = "ZhuDongFangYu.exe" ascii // Qihoo360
$av3 = "egui.exe" ascii // ESET
$av4 = "TMBMSRV.exe" ascii // Trend Micro
$av5 = "ccSetMgr.exe" ascii // Norton
$clipshot = "clipshot" ascii
$ComSpec =  "ComSpec" ascii
$export = "curl_easy_init" ascii
    condition:
        10 of them
}

objects.name: Create or Modify System Process: Windows Service
objects.description: SparrowDoor achieves persistence by installing SearchIndexer.exe as a Windows service, using parameters defined in the malware configuration.

objects.name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
objects.description: If SparrowDoor fails to persist as a Windows Service, it installs SearchIndexer.exe in the CurrentVersion\Run key.

objects.name: Access Token Manipulation: Token Impersonation/Theft
objects.description: SparrowDoor impersonates the user account token associated with the explorer.exe process.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: The SparrowDoor malware file libhost.dll is obfuscated with a 4-byte XOR key and the configuration is obfuscated with an 8-byte XOR key.

objects.name: Hijack Execution Flow: DLL Side-Loading
objects.description: The SparrowDoor malware gains execution when the malware file libcurl.dll is side-loaded by SearchIndexer.exe.

objects.name: Process Injection: Portable Executable Injection
objects.description: SparrowDoor injects itself into a spawned and suspended instance of svchost.exe during initialisation.

objects.name: Indicator Removal on Host: File Deletion
objects.description: SparrowDoor can be tasked to remove arbitrary files from the host. It can also be tasked to delete files specific to the malware execution, i.e. as part of a clean-up routine.

objects.name: Reflective Code Loading
objects.description: SparrowDoor is loaded by a reflective loader found in libhost.dll.

objects.name: Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location
objects.description: A legitimate and signed Notepad++ updater has been renamed SearchIndexer.exe, which is the name of a legitimate Windows binary. This file is used to load SparrowDoor. The malware also uses the name libcurl.dll for its loader, libcurl is a legitimate project.

objects.name: Signed Binary Proxy Execution
objects.description: SparrowDoor is side-loaded into, and hijacks execution of, a signed Notepad++ updater.

objects.name: Software Discovery: Security Software Discovery
objects.description: SparrowDoor checks the running processes against a list of hardcoded AV names.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: SparrowDoor uses HTTPS as a Command and control (C2) channel and is proxy aware.

objects.name: Encrypted Channel: Symmetric Cryptography
objects.description: SparrowDoor uses static XOR keys to encode data when it is being sent or received over the C2 channel.

objects.name: Clipboard Data
objects.description: SparrowDoor can be tasked to launch clipboard logging functionality.

objects.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
objects.description: SparrowDoor can be tasked to exfiltrate files from disk.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Sparrowdoor
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. sparrowdoor.
